message_1: Suppose we have the plaintext "HELLO" and we want to encrypt it using a Caesar cipher with a key of 3. What will be the ciphertext generated by the encryption algorithm?
message_2:
To encrypt the plaintext "HELLO" using a Caesar cipher with a key of 3, we shift each letter in the plaintext by 3 positions forward in the alphabet. If the shift goes beyond 'Z', it wraps around to the beginning of the alphabet.

H -> K
E -> H
L -> O
L -> O
O -> R

The ciphertext generated by the encryption algorithm is "KHOOR".
